alert.note: Alert for Warren (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 2:29AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT WARREN AND WESTERN MCKEAN COUNTIES THROUGH 315 AM EDT... At 228 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles northeast of Warren to 15 miles northwest of Marienville. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Warren, Bradford, Kane, Allegany State Park, Sheffield, Youngsville, Wetmore, Russell, Scandia, Ludlow, Marshburg, Westline, Warren South, Kinzua Dam, Chapman State Park, Tidioute, Starbrick, Clarendon and University Of Pittsburgh - Bradford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
